required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Ginkgo (Gingko Biloba) on Retinal and Choroidal Ocular Tissue
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Ginkgo (Gingko Biloba) on Retinal and Choroidal Ocular Tissue

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York College of Optometry

clinical_study.source: State University of New York College of Optometry

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand the effect of Ginkgo Biloba oral supplements on retinal and choroidal ocular tissue.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study objectives are to:
1. assess the changes from pre- to post- oral supplementation on retinal and choroidal thickness and blood flow, retinal oxygen saturation, ocular perfusion pressure, and retinal function

primary_outcome.description: ocular blood flow measured with doppler ultrasound

arm_group.description: oral intake of gingko biloba for 4 weeks

intervention.description: oral intake of Gingko Biloba, 480mg/day for 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 30 - 55 years, inclusive
- Emmetropes between +1.00 to -0.50, both inclusive
- Myopes greater than -5.00D,
- Good general and ocular health
- Corrected visual acuity of 20/40 or better
- No gingko biloba supplementation within the last 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- All significant ocular and any systemic disorders considered likely to affect the systemic or ocular vasculature
- History of ocular surgery, including refractive surgery
- Use of ocular medications
- Conditions where ginkgo supplementation is contraindicated
- Any eye or systemic disease that affect vision or refractive error
- Current smokers
- Subjects who are pregnant, breastfeeding, or planning conception

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: State University of New York College of Optometry
